column4: anyone have any idea why a single machine runs xp at lightning speed, speeds i've never witnessed on any windows installation ever, while gutsy on the same machine is running at a snail's pace?
is that directed to me, pgjensen?
but bruenig, i've been running ubuntu on several machines, and this is the fastest machine on paper,
all other machines run ubuntu without any performance problems,
is that the command, pgjensen? hdparm?
is there a forum on error 17?
because it seems heaps of people would benefit
oh, another thing, how do i set up an automount for a hdd partition?
no, well there you go, for ubotu :)
isn't one,  set it by sudo passwd
yep, that's the way they set it up
you see the fstab link ubotu did?  basically  /dev/sda3 /mountpoint options
true, but windows is hardcoded to look for those files i think.  Renaming them on the ubuntu box might freak it out
